Anyway, we should welcome a correspondent at a supposedly forward-looking news site that has embraced all the correct thinking calling himself a conservative. It casts a spotlight on the lie that is present-day progressivism.

The shift in attitude toward free expression, the hostility toward Asians and Jews on campus, and the stoking of culture-war nonsense to distract from our economic stratification -- all that is "conservative" in some very small-minded sense. It stifles change. And it's bad.

There were flaws in the old conservatism; there was a faith in the market that feels disconnected from reality. But it was a more ecumenical politics. 

The conservatism of Democratic elites feels more like the king's henchmen pulling up the drawbridge and sealing off the castle.

But there are different hues of conservatism. The conservatism of the Reagan right was confident in itself and committed to protecting institutions w/an eye toward growth, dynamism -- markets. The conservatism of today's left feels scared. Elites afraid of losing what's theirs. https://t.co/596c918XgU

data.text: RT @pescami: Update : I have been suspended from Mastodon for the following exchange. Guess what was my offense.
The new brownshirts are so much like the old ones. https://t.co/tX0r7iSCmT
These are the people who dominate the discourse and have taken over so many of our institutions, those who know only how to tear down and nothing about building, reinventing, renewing.

Do you know what their answer was?

They didn't have an answer. 

They hadn't thought about that.

I'd respond by asking: Right, but what happens if you get everything you want, if your team wins the House, the Senate, the White House, the war of ideas -- what happens if literally everyone comes around to your way of thinking, what does that country look like?

Time and again, they'd say things like: So and so is a Nazi (or communist), and if he/she/they wins, America is done, I mean over, I mean mass death, famine, concentration camps, like really over, like not sort of over but *really* over.

During the campaign, the most striking thing about voters on the illiberal right and left was their agreement that if the other side won the whole world would be over, *and* their shared inability to articulate a positive vision for the world they wanted to inhabit.

tweets.text:
Remarkable that he chose @bariweiss’s substack to deliver the message, which will burn through GOP circles like a gasoline fire. @bariweiss has become huge with her own voice post-@nytimes 

Bill Barr: Trump Will Burn Down the GOP. Time for New Leadership. https://t.co/G2syP6C4p1
#BREAKING: Iran national team players choose not to sing national anthem at World Cup match; some of the Iranian crowed booing their own national anthem https://t.co/RYPvgHMNUi
And lead us not into temptation … https://t.co/8qNOXzwXS9

The leaders of US universities must be paragons of every virtue as they frenetically support the advancement of every ethno-religious-sexual identity except for hetero White males and all Jews. But they are open for business & eager to educate Xi Jinping's scientists & engineers
@petersavodnik The older I get the more I realize Nietzsche was right about everything.
Update : I have been suspended from Mastodon for the following exchange. Guess what was my offense. https://t.co/Gc1KmAGctl

Black Hebrew Israelites out in force today, chanting “we are the real Jews” and “time to wake up,” as they marched towards the Barclay’s Center in support of Kyrie Irving’s return. https://t.co/hUPbbHlsBg

Do you know what their answer was?

They didn't have an answer. 

They hadn't thought about that.

I'd respond by asking: Right, but what happens if you get everything you want, if your team wins the House, the Senate, the White House, the war of ideas -- what happens if literally everyone comes around to your way of thinking, what does that country look like?

Time and again, they'd say things like: So and so is a Nazi (or communist), and if he/she/they wins, America is done, I mean over, I mean mass death, famine, concentration camps, like really over, like not sort of over but *really* over.

During the campaign, the most striking thing about voters on the illiberal right and left was their agreement that if the other side won the whole world would be over, *and* their shared inability to articulate a positive vision for the world they wanted to inhabit.
@petersavodnik @SamHarrisOrg Shocked and amazed that you are in the least bit surprised. 😎

72% of LGBTQ between 18-29 believe their rights are under attack in America, according to our Fall 2022 @HarvardIOP Youth Poll. 

43% strongly agree. https://t.co/26WTbOuiE2

What a coincidence: Yale, Harvard, Stanford, Columbia, Georgetown, and Berkeley all pulled out of the US News and World Report law school rankings within 48 hours of each other, all for the exact same altruistic reasons.

Elite law schools must really care about the poor.

🚨BREAKING: The CPS has DROPPED drop hate charges against two men on the May 2021 “Convoy for Palestine”.

This means that no one is currently charged for the incident that saw protesters honk horns and scream “F*** their mothers, rape their daughters.”
https://t.co/cEAkOd4pPk

urls.title: Anger as hate charges against ‘Palestine Convoy’ pair are dropped
urls.description: The CPS says that they recognise the decision is 'disappointing', but that it would not have been able to prove the cases against the two men
